member.name: M:cipup.engine.finalize
member.summary:
Terminates and flushes the current message to the output, and destroys the internal state of the engine.
If encrypting, writes any buffered bits with any required padding and a terminal character.
If outputting to a file, closes the file.
If encrypting, use bitswritten() for the total number of bits of cyphertext generated from the plaintext and written to the output.
If decrypting, use bytesread() for the number of bytes of plaintext decrypted from the cyphertext and written to the output.
Use init() again to restart the engine by setting the Key, IV, de/encryption action, and output destination.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.overflowbits
member.summary:
Returns the number of post-encryption overflow bits written to the output.
This value will remain zero until after a call to flush() or finalize().
These bits recieved terminal padding to be writen as a full byte. This value will never be greater than 7.
If this value is non-zero after a call to flush() or finalize(), then the number of bytes written is 1 larger than the value returned by byteswritten().
member.returns: A byte containing the number of post-encryption overflow bits.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.byteswritten
member.summary:
Returns the number of post-encryption bytes written to the output.
Does not include overflow bits or terminal padding, so the actual number of bytes written after a call to flush() or finalize() may be 1 larger. See overflowbits() for the number of overflow bits. If this value is non-zero after a call to flush() or finalize(), then the number of bytes written is 1 larger.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer containing the number of post-encryption bytes written to the output. Does not include overflow bits or terminal padding.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.bitswritten
member.summary:
Returns the number of post-encryption bits written to the output.
Does not include terminal padding.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer containing the number of post-encryption bits written to the output. Does not include terminal padding.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.flush
member.summary:
Terminates and flushes the current message to the output, writing any buffered bits with any required padding and a terminal character.
Can only be called when encrypting to a stringstream.
If you want additional messages sequentially linked, you can reuse encrypt() after calling flush().
Use bitswritten() for the total number of bits written to the output.

Encrypts the contents of a stream to the initialized output.
Consumes the entire stream, building into the current (single) message.
You can incrementally encrypt messages by feeding encrypt() data chunks. If you are writing to a stringstream, you can optionally terminate a message using flush(). If you want additional messages sequentially linked, you can reuse encrypt() after calling flush().
Use canwrite() to determine if this action can be performed.
Use bitswritten() for the number of bits of cyphertext generated from the plaintext (non-buffered bits already written to the output).
member.param: istream of plaintext

member.name: M:cipup.engine.op_LeftShift(cipup.engine!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Encrypts the contents of a stream to the initialized output.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.canwrite
member.summary:
Returns the readiness of the engine for encryption.
TRUE if the engine has been initialized for encryption and it is ready.
FALSE otherwise.
If TRUE, then encrypt() can be called.
member.returns: A boolean designating if the engine is ready for encryption.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.bytesread
member.summary:
Returns the number of post-decryption bytes written to the output.
This is the number of bytes of plaintext decrypted from the cyphertext.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer containing the number of post-decryption bytes written to the output.

member.summary:
Decrypts the contents of a stream to the initialized output.
Consumes the entire stream, but only decrypts one (the first) message.
If the stream ends before a terminal character in the message is encountered, then either the message will be cut off or an exception will be thrown.
Use canread() to determine if this action can be performed.
Use bytesread() for the number of bytes of plaintext decrypted from the cyphertext.
member.param: istream of cyphertext containing one message.
member.exception: Thrown when the stream ends before a terminal character in the message is encountered, if the last bits were part of a character's encoding.

Use canread() to determine if this action can be performed.
Use bytesread() for the number of bytes of plaintext decrypted from the cyphertext.
member.param: Stream of cyphertext containing one message.
member.exception: Thrown when the stream ends before a terminal character in the message is encountered, if the last bits were part of a character's encoding.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.canread
member.summary:
Returns the readiness of the engine for decryption.
TRUE if the engine has been initialized for decryption and it is ready.
FALSE otherwise.
If TRUE, then decrypt() can be called.
member.returns: A boolean designating if the engine is ready for decryption.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.ready
member.summary:
Returns the readiness of the engine.
TRUE if the engine has been initialized because init() has been called successfully more recently than finalize.
FALSE if the engine has not been initialized because init() has never been successfully called or finalize has been called more recently than a successful init().
If TRUE, then encrypt() or decrypt() can be called, depending on which has been initialized. Use canread() and canwrite() to determine which action can be performed.
member.returns: A boolean designating the readiness of the engine.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.init(cipup.InitAction,System.SByte!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsSignUnspecifiedByte!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.Boolean,System.Byte*,System.Byte,System.Byte*,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Initializes the engine for encryption or decryption to a file with a Key and IV.
There is an overloaded method for writing to a stringstream.
This method will open the file designated, and append to an existing file if so directed.
member.param: Enum InitAction specifing initialization for encryption or decryption.
Output will be directed to the file designated by this path.
Specifies wheter to append to the file.
Byte array containing the Key.
Length of the Key array in bytes. Required values can be found by calling RequiredKeyByteLength().
Byte array containing the IV.
Length of the IV array in bytes. Required values can be found by calling RequiredIVByteLength().
member.returns: A MessageCode signifying success or reason for failure. Consult engine.Messages for a description of each code.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.Dispose
member.summary:
Destroys the engine.
Automatically calls finalize().

member.name: M:cipup.engine.#ctor
member.summary:
Instantiates the engine, allowing access to non-static member methods.
You must call init() before you can call encrypt() or decrypt().

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GenerateKey(System.Byte**!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,System.Byte,cipup.GenerationTechnique)
member.summary:
Generates a new random Key or IV into the key array.
The key array will be allocated if null.
member.param: Byte array to be filled with generated data.
Length of the array in bytes. Recommended values can be found by calling RequiredKeyByteLength() and RequiredIVByteLength().
Enum GenerationTechnique specifies the technique used to generate random data. LocalEntropicSecureRand is the preferred choice.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GenerateKey(System.Byte[],System.Byte,cipup.GenerationTechnique)
member.summary: Generates a new random Key or IV into the key array.
member.param: Byte array to be filled with generated data.
Length of the array in bytes. Recommended values can be found by calling RequiredKeyByteLength() and RequiredIVByteLength().
Enum GenerationTechnique specifies the technique used to generate random data. LocalEntropicSecureRand is the preferred choice.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GenerateKey(System.Byte**!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Generates a new random Key or IV into the key array. Uses the LocalEntropicSecureRand technique by default.
The key array will be allocated if null.
member.param: Byte array to be filled with generated data.
Length of the array in bytes. Recommended values can be found by calling RequiredKeyByteLength() and RequiredIVByteLength().

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GenerateKey(System.Byte[],System.Byte)
member.summary: Generates a new random Key or IV into the key array. Uses the LocalEntropicSecureRand technique by default.
member.param: Byte array to be filled with generated data.
Length of the array in bytes. Recommended values can be found by calling RequiredKeyByteLength() and RequiredIVByteLength().

member.name: M:cipup.engine.RequiredIVByteLength
member.summary:
Returns the byte length for IVs required by the PRNG that CIPUP employs.
The IV provided to init() must be this length.
member.returns: A byte containing the required byte length of an IV.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.RequiredKeyByteLength
member.summary:
Returns the byte length for keys required by the PRNG that CIPUP employs.
The key provided to init() must be this length.
member.returns: A byte containing the required byte length of a key.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.PrintConfiguration
member.summary:
Prints the configuration text for CIPUP to the console.
The compilation switches that contribute to this text modify CIPUP in such a way that different configurations WILL NOT be compatible.
Hence, if this text is not identical between two builds of CIPUP, they are incompatible.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GetConfiguration
member.summary:
Returns the configuration text for CIPUP.
The compilation switches that contribute to this text modify CIPUP in such a way that different configurations WILL NOT be compatible.
Hence, if this text is not identical between two builds of CIPUP, they are incompatible.
member.returns: A String containing the configuration text for this build of CIPIP.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.PrintVersionText
member.summary:
Prints the version text for CIPUP to the console.
Different versions may or may not be compatible. Consult the build notes and CIPUP website for more information.

member.name: M:cipup.engine.GetVersionText
member.summary:
Returns the version text for CIPUP.
Different versions may or may not be compatible. Consult the build notes and CIPUP website for more information.
member.returns: A String containing the version text for this build of CIPIP.

member.name: F:cipup.engine.Messages
member.summary: Descriptions for the MessageCode returned by init(). Use the MessageCode as the index to this array.

member.name: T:cipup.engine
member.summary:
Cipup engine class. Provides static helper methods. Instantiate to use the engine for encryption or decryption.
CIPUP Is Privacy for the Ultra Paranoid
Output can be directed to a file or stringstream. Input can be directed from a file or stream. Additionally during encryption, input can be provided as a single byte or vector of bytes.
Use init() to start the engine by setting the Key, IV, de/encryption action, and output destination. Use finalize() to stop the engine, purging memory and closing output streams. You can then call init() again.
Once the engine has been started in encryption mode, you can incrementally encrypt messages by feeding encrypt() data chunks. If you are writing to a stringstream, you can optionally terminate a message using flush(). If you want additional messages sequentially linked, you can reuse encrypt() after calling flush(). Note that the stringstream will be purged when calling encrypt() after calling flush(), so consume the stream first.
To decrypt sequentially linked messages, call decrypt() for each message. Note that it will only decrypt one message per call, but it will consume the entire stream or file provided. It is therefore recommended for the input stream or file to only contain one message. Set the input marker of the stream to the appropriate beginning of the message.

member.name: T:cipup.GenerationTechnique
member.summary: Generation technique choices. Use to specify technique used by engine.GenerateKey() to generate random data. LocalEntropicSecureRand is the preferred choice.

member.name: T:cipup.InitAction
member.summary: Initialization action codes. Use to specify initialization for decryption or encryption.

member.name: T:cipup.MessageCode
member.summary: Initialization return codes. Signifies success or reason for failure. Consult engine.Messages for a description of each code.
